title.narrative: Networking and scaling up of agro-ecological activities and bio-diverse farming

description.narrative:
This projects will support Ubinig's Nayakrishi network of farmers to strengthen activities aiming at the regeneration of ecological, social, economic, spiritual and cultural foundation of farming. The network places farming practices based on biodiversity and agroecology, with systems free from pesticides, herbicides, chemicals and external inputs at its heart. Seed preservation, exchange and learning are also key aspect to this network. The network is designed to develop a strong market for organic crops and food. This work funded by CAFOD, includes improving network links with like minded organisations such as Caritas Bangladesh (another CAFOD partner) and will help to contribute CAFOD's programme in Bangladesh, which is aiming to build an interconnected network of like minded organisations who can share and learn together. CAFOD's existing partners such as Caritas Bangladesh, will learn and if beneficial, replicate the learning in their own agroecology focused work. Key activities in this project include training small holder farmers of agroecology techniques, including seed preservation and seed exchanges, through farmer field schools, women farmer networks and community seed banks, exchange visits and network building with likeminded organisations and collective marketing of agro-ecological products.
Specific Objectives 1. Continue to practice, learn and consolidate Nayakrishi through capacity building and scaling up of present activities to cope with livelihood opportunities and market options. 2. Dissemination and extension through networking with farmers and organizations committed to regenerate a biological, ecological and environmental basis of agriculture in order to consolidate and expand an organic and safe food market.
